file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 71-13-01-04 - APRON - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL APRON - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the nacelle apron. These procedures are applicable to the LH and RH engines. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 71-13-01-000-801-A NACELLE APRON - REMOVAL ALL 71-13-01-400-801-A APRON - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 71-13-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 71-13-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. NACELLE APRON - REMOVAL A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to remove the nacelle apron. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 71-12-01-000-801-A/400 ENGINE LOWER COWLING - OPENING C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 413 Lower cowling LH Engine 423 Lower cowling RH Engine D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand Access to the work area 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task Engine nacelle I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Put the workstand in position, and get access to the nacelle apron. (2) Open the engine lower cowling. Refer to AMM TASK 71-12-01-000-801-A/400. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE ENGINE COMPONENTS UNTIL THEY ARE COOL. THE TEMPERATURE STAYS HOT AFTER THE ENGINE STOPS. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 71-13-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) Remove the bolts (6), lock washers (7), and washers (8). (2) Release the two bonding straps (5) from the nacelle apron (3). (3) Remove all pip pins (9) from the tie rod brackets (10) in the nacelle apron (3). (4) Remove the attachment screws (11). (5) Remove the pip pins (4) in the rear part of the nacelle apron. (6) Remove the nacelle apron (3) from its position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 71-13-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Apron - Removal/Installation Figure 401 1 1 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 71-13-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details. ZONES 412 422 TORQUE : 2.3-2.8 Nm (20-25 lb.in) 1. UPPER COWLING A 12. TIE ROD 2. PILON B 11. SCREW DET. A C 3. NACELLE APRON 9. PIP PIN 10. TIE ROD BRACKET (TIE ROD ATTACHMENT) 5. BONDING STRAP 4. PIP PIN 7. LOCK WASHER 6. BOLT 8. WASHER DET. B DET. C 145AMM710006.MCE B

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 71-13-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. APRON - INSTALLATION A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to install the nacelle apron. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 71-12-01-400-801-A/400 ENGINE LOWER COWLING - CLOSING C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 413 Lower cowling LH Engine 423 Lower cowling RH Engine D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand Access to the work area 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task Engine nacelle I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the apron in position, and install the pip pins (4) in the rear part of the nacelle apron. (2) Install the attachment screws (11) to the nacelle apron. (3) Install all pip pins (9) to connect the tie rod (12) in the tie rod brackets (10). (4) Install the two bonding straps (5) with washers (8), lock washers (7), and bolts (6), to the nacelle apron (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 71-13-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close the lower cowling. Refer to AMM TASK 71-12-01-400-801-A/400. NOTE: Make sure that the latches are aligned with the cowling skin. (2) Remove the workstand from the work area. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 71-13-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
